7.title: Running the server
7.content: The IPS sandbox has all the features included. To use it, simply get the files in the ips-server folder and run docker compose up. You’ll see the server landing page on http://localhost:8080 or another URL you may have selected. Feel free to clone and adapt and provide feedback to our community.

8.title: IPS Server
8.content: Using the FHIR IPS specification in a lab or sandbox setting is a great way to get familiar with what the IPS is and isn’t meant for. In this repository we also include a FHIR Server preconfigured with a few IPS enabler features: . | Fully working FHIR server with the IPS conformance artefacts uploaded | A Validator frontend for ease of use by non-technical people | Sample content | A simple IPS viewer for displaying an IPS content in a simpler, more friendly way. | . These features are growing (with your help - please feel free to contribute) and are meant to enable developers, analysts and innovators to focus on building upon the IPS.
